title: Number of tabs memory/cache
content:
Hi I'm wondering if anyone else has this problem. I've set it so that FF asks me if I want to close all tabs when I close a window or exit. This is to restore pages when I restart next. What I've noticed is, this number of tabs in the question only keeps increasing -for example, if I have 50 tabs open, close 10 of them during a browsing session and open 20 more, when I go to exit, it'll ask me if I want to close 80 tabs. And when I start up FF next time, that number 80 just keeps increasing when I open/close tabs. It doesn't seem to be refreshing the 'tab memory'. There needs to be a button perhaps that purges that tab cache and takes a fresh 'reading' of all current tabs open and updating the total number.

Anyone else experiencing this? Thanks
creator: glennfen

title: No Sync / Roaming Folder Deleted
content:
Hello, I recently had a problem with my synchronization due to an error in windows. The app data > roaming folder has been deleted, and after logging into firefox again my bookmarks data is not being downloaded. 

 > I believe that due to the data being deleted, firefox may have synchronized this cleaning and saved this change on the server, but when the roaming folder is deleted, the login disconnects, someone to help me?
